name: To Kill a Mockingbird
title: To Kill a Mockingbird
description: Harper Lee’s Pulitzer Prize-winning masterwork of honor and injustice in the deep South, a novel of great compassion and courage that tackles the moral nature of humanity.
George Orwell’s bleakly prophetic vision of a totalitarian future, where reality is constantly manipulated and the individual is crushed by the oppressive weight of authoritarian rule.

name: The Great Gatsby
title: The Great Gatsby
description: F. Scott Fitzgerald’s classic novel of the Jazz Age, a story of the mysterious Jay Gatsby and his obsessive pursuit of the American Dream amidst the decadence and corruption of the 1920s.

name: Pride and Prejudice
title: Pride and Prejudice
description: Jane Austen’s beloved novel about Elizabeth Bennet and her complex relationship with the enigmatic Mr. Darcy, a tale of love, social standing, and personal growth set in early 19th-century England.

name: The Catcher in the Rye
title: The Catcher in the Rye
description: J.D. Salinger’s classic novel of teenage rebellion and angst, following Holden Caulfield’s tumultuous journey through New York City as he struggles with his identity and place in a world he finds increasingly phony.

name: Moby Dick
title: Moby Dick
description: Herman Melville’s epic tale of obsession and revenge, following Captain Ahab’s relentless quest to destroy the monstrous white whale, Moby Dick, in a story of grandeur and tragedy.

name: The Hobbit
title: The Hobbit
description: J.R.R. Tolkien’s enchanting prelude to The Lord of the Rings, recounting Bilbo Baggins’ unexpected adventure with dwarves and a dragon, filled with magic, heroism, and the spirit of exploration.

name: Fahrenheit 451
title: Fahrenheit 451
description: Ray Bradbury’s visionary work of dystopian fiction, depicting a future where books are banned and 'firemen' burn them, exploring themes of censorship, conformity, and the power of literature.

name: Brave New World
title: Brave New World
description: Aldous Huxley’s provocative novel about a technologically advanced future society that achieves apparent harmony and stability at the cost of individual freedom and human values.

name: Catch-22
title: Catch-22
description: Joseph Heller’s satirical novel set during World War II, centered on the absurdity and contradictions of war, where the term 'Catch-22' has become synonymous with bureaucratic absurdity and the struggle for sanity.
